page.title: 16FARMING, FORESTRY
page.content: Some planting of conifers to serve as shelter belts has been carried out on these farms for many decades and several strips of mature timber which are no longer of much use for shelter are to be seen on the Cnewr land. However a third aspect of the integrated plan for Cnewr is to lease larger tracts of land for coniferous plantations. Because of its situation within the Brecon Beacons National Park there has been some controversy about this aspect of the plan. However in 1980 the Secretary of State for Wales finally decreed that planting should go ahead. Siting of plantations has been done so skilfully that it is difficult to see where planting has been done from any of the roads in this part of the area. It shows that forestry does not necessar- ily conflict with amenitiy interests.
